skill.name: parallel-workflows
skill.description: Optimizes parallel execution of multiple tasks. Use when user mentions 並列で実行, 同時にやって, まとめてやって, run in parallel, do these together. Do NOT load for: 単一タスク, 順次実行が必要な作業, 依存関係のあるタスク.
skill.summary: Optimizes parallel execution of multiple independent tasks using Task tool for concurrent processing.
skill.author: Chachamaru127

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is documentation-only, providing guidance on using the Task tool for parallel execution. No shell commands, network requests, or cryptographic operations are performed.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple independent tasks sequentially wastes time. This skill optimizes parallel execution by identifying independent tasks and running them concurrently using the Task tool, reducing overall execution time by up to 67%.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes task dependencies to identify parallelizable work
Launches multiple Task tool agents concurrently
Generates unified execution reports with timing metrics
Handles partial task failures with retry options
limitations: Only works with independent tasks that have no file or data dependencies
Does not modify source code directly
Requires Tasks to be defined in Plans.md format

use_cases.title: Multi-file Project Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze different directories of a codebase simultaneously. Instead of processing src/components, src/lib, and src/app sequentially, the skill launches three agents in parallel to complete the analysis in one-third the time.

use_cases.title: Quality Checks Pipeline
use_cases.description: Run linting, type-checking, and tests simultaneously. The skill executes all quality checks in parallel, then reports results in a unified format, ideal for CI/CD pre-commit workflows.

use_cases.title: Component Development Sprint
use_cases.description: Create multiple independent UI components concurrently. The skill detects independent components from Plans.md and builds them in parallel, significantly accelerating frontend development.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Project Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this project structure. Use parallel execution to examine different directories concurrently: components/, lib/, and app/. Report findings for each directory.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to understand a large codebase quickly

prompt_templates.title: Run All Quality Checks
prompt_templates.prompt: Run all quality checks in parallel: lint, type-check, and tests. Wait for all to complete then provide a unified summary of results.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need quick feedback on code quality

prompt_templates.title: Build Multiple Features
prompt_templates.prompt: Create these components in parallel: header, footer, and sidebar. Each component should be built independently without sharing files.

prompt_templates.title: Review Multiple Modules
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these three modules for code quality issues. Run all three reviews in parallel and compile a combined report.

best_practices: Define independent tasks clearly with no shared file dependencies
Use Plans.md format to specify tasks for parallel execution
Review the dependency analysis before running parallel tasks
anti_patterns: Attempting to parallelize tasks with shared file dependencies
Running database migrations in parallel (causes locks)

faq.question: What tasks can be parallelized?
faq.answer: Tasks that do not share files, data outputs, or execution order. Each task must be completely independent.

faq.question: How much faster is parallel execution?
faq.answer: Performance gains depend on task count. Three independent tasks typically complete 60-67% faster than sequential execution.

faq.question: What happens if one parallel task fails?
faq.answer: Successful task results are preserved. Failed tasks show error details with options to retry just those tasks.

faq.question: Can I control how many tasks run in parallel?
faq.answer: The skill optimizes based on available resources. For very large task sets, consider breaking into smaller batches.

faq.question: Does this skill execute shell commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation patterns using the Task tool. Actual command execution depends on the tasks you define.

faq.question: What trigger phrases activate this skill?
faq.answer: Japanese: 並列で実行, 同時にやって, まとめてやって. English: run in parallel, do these together, check all.
